channel.title: OpenGL
channel.description:
Alright, I have all the hooks for a possible OpenGL bot.
But i still have some O_o moments...
I can generate a log with all the models right, with vertex coords etc. Now how will i make it so it will gather the coords from all the models in the log, and know the texture coords? I know how to generate ids but this is my only flaw..
Help is very appreciated.

item.title: OpenGL
item.dc:creator: @Nissan_Nut Nissan Nut
item.description:
@Nissan_Nut wrote:

Contact me, skype: nissan.nut or email me peletgun23@hotmail.com

Read full topic

item.title: OpenGL
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Uh, presuming they are constructing vbos, just extract the data uploaded to a particular vbo and then look at how they setup their vertex attributes and shaders to figure out which stride in the vbo data represents which vertex attribute. One will be a texture coordinate (most likely a vec2, unless they evened out their vertex attributes and are using vec4 across the board). In order to find the texcoord, look for texture() or texture2D() (depending on whatever shader lang version they are using; deprecation varies).

Read full topic

i always use a fetcher in place of a gather.
